Description: Bank of America announced a settlement with the Federal National Mortgage Association (Fannie Mae) to resolve outstanding and potential repurchase and certain other claims relating to the origination, sale and delivery of substantially all residential mortgage loans originated and sold directly to Fannie Mae from January 1, 2000 through December 31, 2008 by entities related to Countrywide Financial Corporation and Bank of America. As part of the agreement Bank of America agreed to make a cash payment to Fannie Mae of $3.6 billion and also repurchase for $6.75 billion certain residential mortgage loans sold to Fannie Mae.

Bank of America announced agreements with the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation (Freddie Mac) and the Federal National Mortgage Association (Fannie Mae) to resolve repurchase claims involving certain residential mortgage loans sold to them by entities related to Countrywide Financial Corporation.

Bank of America announced agreements with the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation (Freddie Mac) and the Federal National Mortgage Association (Fannie Mae) to resolve repurchase claims involving certain residential mortgage loans sold to them by entities related to Countrywide Financial Corporation.
Freddie Mac announced a settlement with Bank of America concerning Freddie Mac's claims related to representations and warranties on single-family loans sold to Freddie Mac.

The Federal Housing Finance Agency announced a settlement in cases involving Bank of America, Countrywide Financial, Merrill Lynch concerning alleged violations of federal and state securities laws in connection with private-label, residential mortgage-backed securities  purchased by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac between 2005 and 2007.

The Federal Housing Finance Agency announced a settlement with Barclays Bank PLC resolving alleged violations of federal and state securities laws in connection with private-label mortgage-backed securities purchased by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac during 2005-2007.

Citigroup announced an agreement with Fannie Mae to resolve potential future repurchase claims for breaches of representations and warranties on 3.7 million residential first mortgage loans sold to Fannie Mae that were originated between 2000 and 2012. Citi agreed to pay Fannie Mae $968 million under the agreement.
Freddie Mac announced a settlement with Citimortgage and Citibank concerning representations and warranties on single-family loans sold to Freddie Mac.

Recap of Ownership Changes: UBS took over Credit Suisse in 2023
Description: The Federal Housing Finance Agency announced a settlement with Credit Suisse resolving alleged violations of federal and state securities laws in connection with private-label mortgage-backed securities purchased by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac during 2005-2007.

The Federal Housing Finance Agency announced a settlement with Deutsche Bank AG resolving alleged violations of federal and state securities laws in connection with private-label mortgage-backed securities purchased by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac between 2005 and 2007.

The Federal Housing Finance Agency announced a settlement for $110 million with First Horizon National Corporation resolving alleged violations of federal and District of Columbia securities laws in connection with private-label mortgage-backed securities purchased by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac during 2005-2007.

The Federal Housing Finance Agency announced a settlement with Goldman Sachs concerning alleged violations of federal and state securities laws in connection with private-label mortgage-backed securities purchased by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac between 2005 and 2007.

The Federal Housing Finance Agency announced a settlement of $550 million with HSBC North America Holdings Inc. resolving alleged violations of federal, Virginia and District of Columbia securities laws in connection with private-label mortgage-backed securities purchased by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac during 2005-2007.

The Federal Housing Finance Agency announced a settlement with Morgan Stanley resolving alleged violations of federal and state securities laws and common law fraud in connection with private-label mortgage-backed securities purchased by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac between 2005 and 2007.

Recap of Ownership Changes: RBS Group changed its name to NatWest Group in 2020
Description: The Federal Housing Finance Agency announced a settlement for $99.5 million with RBS Securities, Inc. for alleged violations of federal and state securities laws in connection with private-label mortgage-backed securities purchased by Freddie Mac during 2005-2007.

Recap of Ownership Changes: RBS Group changed its name to NatWest Group in 2020
Description: The Federal Housing Finance Agency, as conservator of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, reached a settlement with Royal Bank of Scotland Group plc, related companies and specifically named individuals for $5.5 billion. The settlement resolved all claims in the lawsuit, FHFA v. The Royal Bank of Scotland Group plc et al., Case No. 3:11-cv-1383 in the United States District Court for the District of Connecticut.

The Federal Housing Finance Agency announced a settlement with Societe Generale resolving alleged violations of federal and state securities laws in connection with private-label mortgage-backed securities purchased by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac during 2006.

Recap of Ownership Changes: SunTrust Banks and BB&T merged and formed Truist Financial in 2019
Description: Freddie Mac announced a settlement with SunTrust Mortgage concerning representations and warranties on single-family loans sold to Freddie Mac.

The Federal Housing Finance Agency announced a settlement with UBS Americas, Inc. for $885 million resolving alleged violations of federal and state securities laws in connection with private-label residential mortgage-backed securities purchased by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac.
Fannie Mae reached a $591 million agreement with Wells Fargo to resolve repurchase requests on certain loans originated prior to 2009.
Freddie Mac announced a settlement with Wells Fargo concerning representations and warranties on single-family loans sold to Freddie Mac.
